name: Insecure Automated Optimizations
description: The product uses a mechanism that automatically optimizes code, e.g. to improve a characteristic such as performance, but the optimizations can have an unintended side effect that might violate an intended security assumption.

x_mitre_observed_examples.description: Intel, ARM, and AMD processor optimizations related to speculative execution and branch prediction cause access control checks to be bypassed when placing data into the cache. Often known as "Spectre".
C compiler optimization, as allowed by specifications, removes code that is used to perform checks to detect integer overflows.
